task.title: Manage Instances
task.shortdesc: This page allows you to view a list of your instances, create new instances, and perform actions on your instances. You can page through the list of instances by clicking the navigation buttons at the bottom of the screen.

step.cmd: You can toggle between the table view and the grid view by clicking the appropriate icon next to the View label at the top right of the screen.
Sort the instance list by selecting a sort order using the Sort by drop-down list box.

task.title: Searching and Filtering the Instance List

step.cmd: To perform a simple search/filter, type some search text into the search text box at the top right of the page.
For more precise filtering and searching, you can add one or more filters by clicking one of the availabile filters in the Filter by section on the right side of the page.
Click the Launch new instance button. The Launch Instance dialog box will appear.

task.title: Viewing Details of an Instance
task.shortdesc: Several items in the instance list allow you to click on them to see more detailed information.

taskbody.context: To see more details about an instance, or an object associated with an instance:

step.cmd: Click the name/ID in the list of instances to display detailed information about the selected instance.
Click an image ID to see to see detailed information about the image used to launch the selected instance.
Click a key name to see detailed information about the security key used to launch the instance.
Click a security group name to see detailed information about the security group used to launch the instance.

task.title: Context menu actions
task.shortdesc: Each entry in the instance list has a context menu, accessible in the Actions column. Clicking the action icon brings up a menu of actions that you can perform on the selected instance.

taskbody.context: The following context menu actions are availabe:

step.cmd: This item will bring up the instance detail page.
Selecting this menu will display a dialog with instructions detailing how to connect to the selected instance.
Selecting this menu will display a dialog that allows you to create and customize an instance like the selected instance.

A launch configuration is used to define the parameters for new instances that are launched as part of your auto scaling group. Selecting this menu displays the Create new launch configuration wizard.

info.note: For more information on Auto Scaling, please see Using Auto Scaling in the Eucalyptus User Guide.

step.cmd: Selecting this menu will display a dialog box showing the selected instance's console output.
This menu item allows you to associate an elastic IP address with the selected instance.
Select Associate IP address from the Actions menu to show the volume management page that will allow you to attach and detach volumes for the selected instance.
Select this item to stop the selected instance.
Select this item to reboot the selected instance.
Select this to terminate the selected instance.

info.note: A terminated instance can't be restarted.
